title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 43.3 - Location of required lighting on vehicles 80 inches or more in width
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 43.3 - Location of required lighting on vehicles 80 inches or more in width

State Regulations

All vehicles 80 inches or more in width shall have required
lighting located in conformity with table II. Table II-Location of Required Equipment For Vehicles
80 or More Inches Overall Width

Item

Passenger vehicles, trucks and buses

Location on: trailers

Height above road
surface measured from center of item on vehicle at curb
weight

Headlamps

Type one headlamps at the same time height, one on
each on each side of the vertical centerline; type two headlamps at the same
height, one on each side of the vertical centerline; as far apart as
practicable. Not required. Not less than 24 inches, nor more than 54 inches

Tail lamps

On the rear, one on each side of the vertical
centerline, at the same height, and as far apart as practicable. On the rear, one on each side of vertical centerline, at the same height and as far apart as practicable. Not less than 15 inches, nor more than 72 inches

Stop lamps

On the rear, one on on each side of the vertical
centerline, at the same height, and as far apart as practicable. On the rear, one each side of the vertical
centerline, at the same height and as far apart as practicable. Not less than 15 inches, nor more than 72 inches

Number plate lamp

At rear number plate, to illuminate the plate from
the top or sides. At rear number plate, to illuminate the plate from
the top or sides. No requirement. Backup lamp

On the rear. Not required. No requirement. Turn-signal lamps

At or near the front- one amber on each side of the
vertical centerline, at the same height, and as far apart as practicable. On the rear-one red or amber on each side of the
vertical centerline, at the same height, height, and as far apart as
practicable. Not less than 15 inches, nor more than 83
inches. On the rear-one red or amber on each side of the
vertical centerline, at the same height, and as far apart as practicable. Identification lamps

On the front and rear- three lamps, amber in front, red in rear, as close as practicable to the top of the vehicle, at the same
height, as close as practicable to the vertical centerline, with lamp centers
spaced not less than 6 inches nor more than 12 inches apart. On the rear-three lamps as close as practicable to
the top of the vehicle at the same height, as close as practicable to the
vertical centerline, with lamp centers spaced not less than 6 inches nor more
than 12 inches apart. On the front only. No part of the lamps or mountings
shall extend below the top of the vehicle's windshield. Clearance lamps

On the front and rear- two amber lamps on front, two
red lamps on rear, to indicate the overall width of the vehicle, one on each
side of the vertical centerline, at the same height, and as near the top as
practicable.*** *
On the front and rear-two amber lamps onfront, two
red lamps on rear, to indicate the overall width of the vehicle, one on each
side of the vertical centerline, at the same height, and as near the top
thereof as practicable.*** ****
No requirement. Intermediate side marker lamps

On each side-one amber lamp located at or near the
midpoint between the front and rear side marker lamps

On each side-one amber lamp located at or near the
midpoint between the front and rear side marker lamps. Not less than 15 inches. Intermediate side reflex reflectors

On each side-one amber located at or near the
midpoint between the front and rear side reflex reflectors. On each side-one amber located at or near the
midpoint between the front and rear side reflex reflectors. Not less than 15 inches nor more than 60 inches. Reflex reflectors

On the rear-one red on each side of the vertical
centerline, as far apart as practicable, and at the same height. On each
side-one red as far as to the rear as practicable, and one amber as far to the
front as practicable.**
On the rear-one red on each side of the vertical
centerline, as far apart as practicable, and at the same height. On each
side-one red as far to the rear as practicable, and one amber as far to the
front as practicable. Not less than 15 inches nor more than 60 inches. Side marker lamps

On each side-one red as far to the rear as
practicable, and one amber as far to the front as practicable. On each side-one red as far to the rear as
practicable, and one amber as far to the front as practicable. Not less than 15 inches and on the rear of trailers
not more than 60 inches. *
On a tractor, clearance lamps
mounted on the cab may be located to indicate the overall width of the cab, rather than the overall width of the vehicle. **
On a tractor, the red rear
reflex reflectors may be mounted on the back of the cab, at a minimum height
not less than four inches above the height of the rear tires. ***
When the rear identification
lamps are mounted at the extreme height of a vehicle, red clearance lamps need
not meet the requirements of table II that they be located as close as
practicable to the top of the vehicle. ****
Boat trailers need not be
equipped with both front and rear clearance lamps, provided an amber (to front)
and red (to rear) clearance lamp is located at or near the midpoint on each
side of the trailer so as to indicate its extreme width. Notes
